adjectives.description: controlled (comparative more controlled, superlative most controlled)

entries.meaning: Inhibited or restrained in one's words and actions.
(medicine, sciences, research) Resulting from a comparison with control samples; including a comparison (control) group. (describing clinical trials)
(in combination) Under the control of the specified entity.
examples: The history of the Anglo-Indian Community in British-controlled India is one of many ups and downs, of vicissitudes and prosperity, of security and insecurity.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of control
